verses.verse: I am the rose <S%H2261><s%> of Sharon, <S%H8289><s%> and the lily <S%H7799><s%> of the valleys. <S%H6010><s%>
As the lily <S%H7799><s%> among <S%H996><s%> thorns, <S%H2336><s%> so <S%H3651><s%> is my love <S%H7474><s%> among <S%H996><s%> the daughters. <S%H1323><s%>

As the apple <S%H8598><s%> tree <S%H6086><s%> among the trees <S%H6086><s%> of the wood, <S%H3293><s%> so <S%H3651><s%> is my beloved <S%H1730><s%> among <S%H996><s%> the sons. <S%H1121><s%> I sat <S%H3427><s%> down under his shadow <S%H6738><s%> with great delight, <S%H2530><s%> and his fruit <S%H6529><s%> was sweet <S%H4966><s%> to my taste. <S%H2441><s%>
He brought <S%H935><s%> me to the banqueting <S%H3196><s%> house, <S%H1004><s%> and his banner <S%H1714><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> me was love. <S%H160><s%>
Stay <S%H5564><s%> me with flagons, <S%H809><s%> comfort <S%H7502><s%> me with apples: <S%H8598><s%> for I am sick <S%H2470><s%> of love. <S%H160><s%>
His left <S%H8040><s%> hand <S%H8040><s%> is under <S%H8478><s%> my head, <S%H7218><s%> and his right <S%H3225><s%> hand <S%H3225><s%> does embrace <S%H2263><s%> me.

I charge <S%H7650><s%> you, O you daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> by the roes, <S%H6643><s%> and by the hinds <S%H355><s%> of the field, <S%H7704><s%> that you stir <S%H5782><s%> not up, nor <S%H518><s%> awake <S%H5782><s%> my love, <S%H160><s%> till <S%H5704><s%> he please. <S%H2654><s%>

The voice <S%H6963><s%> of my beloved! <S%H1730><s%> behold, <S%H2009><s%> he comes <S%H935><s%> leaping <S%H1801><s%> on the mountains, <S%H2022><s%> skipping <S%H7092><s%> on the hills. <S%H1389><s%>

My beloved <S%H1730><s%> is like <S%H1819><s%> a roe <S%H6643><s%> or <S%H176><s%> a young <S%H6082><s%> hart: <S%H354><s%> behold, <S%H2009><s%> he stands <S%H5975><s%> behind <S%H310><s%> our wall, <S%H3796><s%> he looks <S%H7688><s%> forth at <S%H4480><s%> the windows, <S%H2474><s%> showing <S%H6692><s%> himself through <S%H4480><s%> the lattice. <S%H2762><s%>
My beloved <S%H1730><s%> spoke, <S%H6030><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> to me, Rise <S%H6965><s%> up, my love, <S%H7474><s%> my fair <S%H3302><s%> one, and come <S%H3212><s%> away.
For, see, <S%H2009><s%> the winter <S%H5638><s%> is past, <S%H5674><s%> the rain <S%H1653><s%> is over <S%H2498><s%> and gone; <S%H1980><s%>

The flowers <S%H5339><s%> appear <S%H7200><s%> on the earth; <S%H776><s%> the time <S%H6256><s%> of the singing <S%H2158><s%> of birds is come, <S%H5060><s%> and the voice <S%H6963><s%> of the turtle <S%H8449><s%> is heard <S%H8085><s%> in our land; <S%H776><s%>

The fig <S%H8384><s%> tree puts <S%H2590><s%> forth <S%H2590><s%> her green <S%H6291><s%> figs, <S%H6291><s%> and the vines <S%H1612><s%> with the tender grape <S%H5563><s%> give <S%H5414><s%> a good smell. <S%H7381><s%> Arise, <S%H6965><s%> my love, <S%H7474><s%> my fair <S%H3302><s%> one, and come <S%H3212><s%> away.

O my dove, <S%H3123><s%> that are in the clefts <S%H2288><s%> of the rock, <S%H5553><s%> in the secret <S%H5643><s%> places of the stairs, <S%H4095><s%> let me see <S%H7200><s%> your countenance, <S%H4758><s%> let me hear <S%H8085><s%> your voice; <S%H6963><s%> for sweet <S%H6149><s%> is your voice, <S%H6963><s%> and your countenance <S%H4758><s%> is comely. <S%H5000><s%>

Take <S%H270><s%> us the foxes, <S%H7776><s%> the little <S%H6996><s%> foxes, <S%H7776><s%> that spoil <S%H2254><s%> the vines: <S%H3754><s%> for our vines <S%H3754><s%> have tender grapes. <S%H5563><s%>
My beloved <S%H1730><s%> is mine, and I am his: he feeds <S%H7462><s%> among the lilies. <S%H7799><s%>

Until <S%H5704><s%> the day <S%H3117><s%> break, <S%H6315><s%> and the shadows <S%H6752><s%> flee <S%H5127><s%> away, turn, <S%H5437><s%> my beloved, <S%H1730><s%> and be you like <S%H1819><s%> a roe <S%H6643><s%> or <S%H176><s%> a young <S%H6082><s%> hart <S%H354><s%> on the mountains <S%H2022><s%> of Bether. <S%H1336><s%>
